newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy's Juventus aims for listing, but not yet.
newsitem.headline: Italy's Juventus aims for listing, but not yet.

text.p: Italian soccer team Juventus is planning a stock market listing but not in the short term, Antonio Giraudo, managing director of the European Cup holders and leaders of Italy's Serie A, said on Thursday.

"The stock market is an objective for Juventus, but not in the short term, we belong to a sector that is living in a time of major restructuring," he said while attending a conference here on listing sporting companies on the bourse.
"We intend to go to the bourse only when the balance sheet will be structural solid. We have to study a plan carefully before putting it forward to potential investors," he added.

In March, Juventus honorary president Umberto Agnelli said the Turin-based club had no immediate intention of seeking a stock market listing, after some clubs such as AC Milan and Bologna had expressed an interest in a stock market flotation.

The Agnelli family holding company IFI currently holds directly some 99.6 percent of the share capital of Juventus. IFI has a controlled stake in IFIL, and IFIL and IFI together are the largest shareholders in industrial group Fiat.
